ack.title: Acknowledgments
ack.p: We would like to thank the Anne Ray Foundation for funding this project. We would like to acknowledge two anonymous reviewers for helping to improve this manuscript. We would like to thank Mark Nigrelli and the U.S. Forest Service for generously providing unpublished data related to 4FRI and this project. We would like to thank Stephen Horner for providing estimates of the wood products coming from harvest materials in the region. We would like to acknowledge Rob Scheller, Will Flatley, and Matt Hurteau for technical expertise and advice on the LANDIS‐II models. We would like to thank the New Mexico Chapter of TNC, specifically Laura McCarthy, Anne Bradley, and Steven Bassett, for initial discussions on forest carbon work in the southwest. The data set used for future climate data, MACAv2‐METDATA, was produced with funding from the Regional Approaches to Climate Change (REACCH) project and the Southeast Climate Adaptation Science Center (SECASC). We acknowledge the World Climate Research Programme's Working Group on Coupled Modeling, which is responsible for CMIP, and we thank the climate modeling groups for producing and making available their model output. For CMIP, the U.S. Department of Energy's Program for Climate Model Diagnosis and Intercomparison provides coordinating support and led development of software infrastructure in partnership with the Global Organization for Earth System Science Portals.
